issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Hi there-

I am building an iOS app after an upgrade to the 2.1.3 GA Titanium SDK.  I also have XCode v 4.5.1 w/ the iOS 6 SDK.  I uninstalled the previous XCode versions.

When attempting to build, I get the following error:

{panel}
dyld: Library not loaded: @rpath/DevToolsFoundation.framework/Versions/A/DevToolsFoundation 
  Referenced from:  /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Platforms/iPhoneSimulator.platform/Developer/Library/PrivateFramework
  Reason: image not found
{panel}

I noticed in the 2.1.3 Release notes that there was an issue relating to this (I believe), since the latest XCode has moved the Development directory:

TIMOB-10854

...yet, I am still encountering this issue.  Any ideas to get past this to continue the install?
fields.summary: Cannot Launch / Build iOS app with New Appcelerator SDK and new Xcode

comments.body:
Went to the forum community and resolved via forums.

http://support.appcelerator.com/tickets/APP-188979
